title: The fevered weeks which sealed an 'impossible' deal: how Boris Johnson crafted his Brexit plan in face of EU hostility
text:
The outlook could scarcely have been more bleak: with less than 10 days to go before EU leaders were due to in Brussels for a crunch Brexit summit, Downing Street officials pronounced that a deal was “essentially impossible”.

Boris Johnson had just put the phone down from a 40-minute phone call with the German Chancellor Angela Merkel to try and break the impasse in Brussels, but instead had come away utterly disheartened.

It was, a Downing Street source added, a “clarifying moment” that a deal couldn’t actually be done. On the EU side the hostile briefing of a private phone call only deepened the sense of hopelessness. It was October 8.
